bug.short_desc: We are setting a new appearance for a widget and the new appearance is not processed correctly

long_desc.thetext: I check this next week. How fast do you need a fix for that?
At the moment, we have implemented a work-around for this issue. Therefore we have no deadline for a fix.

Now we have run into this bug again!
I wanted to implement a new functionality that required that the appearance of a widget is changed at runtime. Now I had to cancel the implementation of this functionality due to this bug.
It is not possible to implement a work-around for this bug by calling methods like "syncAppearance", "updateAppearance" or "scheduleLayoutUpdate".
Therefore I would recommend that this bug is fixed before the version 1.3.
We sure will fix this bug before 1.3. My plan is to take care of it in two weeks.

Just a reminder to check that we don't reintroduce bug #2652 which was fixed with r19925 [1].
http://qooxdoo.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/qooxdoo/trunk/qooxdoo/framework/source/class/qx/ui/core/Widget.js?r1=19925&r2=19924&pathrev=19925

Any news here concerning a demo application / sample code that demonstrates the bug? Without sample code it is very difficult for us to fix this one (especially if it should make it into the upcoming 1.4 release).
Thanks for the demo. I'll take care of that soon.

Uwe, thanks for the good demo application. I managed to get why that happend. The reason is that the change happend from a appearance which did not exists to an existing one. Therefore, no old data was available and the selector did not get deleted.
Added a unit test to check that behavior for regressions:
trunk: r25228 1.3.x: r25229
This fix has been successfully testet by the reporter of this issue.
